speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: SCENE I. The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Neither my husband nor the slave return'd,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That in such haste I sent to seek his master!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Sure, Luciana, it is two o'clock.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Perhaps some merchant hath invited him,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: And from the mart he's somewhere gone to dinner.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Good sister, let us dine and never fret:

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: A man is master of his liberty:

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Time is their master, and, when they see time,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: They'll go or come: if so, be patient, sister.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Why should their liberty than ours be more?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Because their business still lies out o' door.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Look, when I serve him so, he takes it ill.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: O, know he is the bridle of your will.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: There's none but asses will be bridled so.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Why, headstrong liberty is lash'd with woe.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: There's nothing situate under heaven's eye

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: But hath his bound, in earth, in sea, in sky:

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: The beasts, the fishes, and the winged fowls,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Are their males' subjects and at their controls:

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Men, more divine, the masters of all these,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Lords of the wide world and wild watery seas,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Indued with intellectual sense and souls,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Of more preeminence than fish and fowls,

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Are masters to their females, and their lords:

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Then let your will attend on their accords.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: This servitude makes you to keep unwed.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Not this, but troubles of the marriage-bed.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: But, were you wedded, you would bear some sway.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Ere I learn love, I'll practise to obey.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: How if your husband start some other where?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Till he come home again, I would forbear.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Patience unmoved! no marvel though she pause;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: They can be meek that have no other cause.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: A wretched soul, bruised with adversity,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: We bid be quiet when we hear it cry;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: But were we burdened with like weight of pain,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: As much or more would we ourselves complain:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: So thou, that hast no unkind mate to grieve thee,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: With urging helpless patience wouldst relieve me,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: But, if thou live to see like right bereft,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: This fool-begg'd patience in thee will be left.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Well, I will marry one day, but to try.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Here comes your man; now is your husband nigh.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Enter DROMIO of Ephesus

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Say, is your tardy master now at hand?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, he's at two hands with me, and that my two ears

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: can witness.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Say, didst thou speak with him? know'st thou his mind?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Ay, ay, he told his mind upon mine ear:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Beshrew his hand, I scarce could understand it.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Spake he so doubtfully, thou couldst not feel his meaning?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, he struck so plainly, I could too well feel his

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: blows; and withal so doubtfully that I could scarce

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: understand them.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: But say, I prithee, is he coming home? It seems he

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: hath great care to please his wife.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Why, mistress, sure my master is horn-mad.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Horn-mad, thou villain!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I mean not cuckold-mad;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But, sure, he is stark mad.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: When I desired him to come home to dinner,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: He ask'd me for a thousand marks in gold:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ''Tis dinner-time,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'Your meat doth burn,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'Will you come home?' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'Where is the thousand marks I gave thee, villain?'

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'The pig,' quoth I, 'is burn'd;' 'My gold!' quoth he:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'My mistress, sir' quoth I; 'Hang up thy mistress!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I know not thy mistress; out on thy mistress!'

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Quoth who?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Quoth my master:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: 'I know,' quoth he, 'no house, no wife, no mistress.'

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: So that my errand, due unto my tongue,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I thank him, I bare home upon my shoulders;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For, in conclusion, he did beat me there.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go back again, thou slave, and fetch him home.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Go back again, and be new beaten home?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For God's sake, send some other messenger.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Back, slave, or I will break thy pate across.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And he will bless that cross with other beating:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Between you I shall have a holy head.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Hence, prating peasant! fetch thy master home.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Am I so round with you as you with me,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That like a football you do spurn me thus?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You spurn me hence, and he will spurn me hither:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: If I last in this service, you must case me in leather.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Fie, how impatience loureth in your face!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: His company must do his minions grace,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Whilst I at home starve for a merry look.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Hath homely age the alluring beauty took

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: From my poor cheek? then he hath wasted it:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Are my discourses dull? barren my wit?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: If voluble and sharp discourse be marr'd,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Unkindness blunts it more than marble hard:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Do their gay vestments his affections bait?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That's not my fault: he's master of my state:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What ruins are in me that can be found,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: By him not ruin'd? then is he the ground

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Of my defeatures. My decayed fair

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: A sunny look of his would soon repair

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: But, too unruly deer, he breaks the pale

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And feeds from home; poor I am but his stale.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Self-harming jealousy! fie, beat it hence!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Unfeeling fools can with such wrongs dispense.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I know his eye doth homage otherwhere,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Or else what lets it but he would be here?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Sister, you know he promised me a chain;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Would that alone, alone he would detain,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: So he would keep fair quarter with his bed!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I see the jewel best enamelled

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Will lose his beauty; yet the gold bides still,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That others touch, and often touching will

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Wear gold: and no man that hath a name,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: By falsehood and corruption doth it shame.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Since that my beauty cannot please his eye,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I'll weep what's left away, and weeping die.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: How many fond fools serve mad jealousy!

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Exeunt
